meanings.definition: The quality or state of causing worry or concern.
meanings.sent1: The worrisomeness of the dark alley made her hesitate.
meanings.sent2: His constant worrisomeness about the future was exhausting.
meanings.sent3: The worrisomeness of forgetting your keys at home is a common annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The worrisomeness of the storm clouds looming overhead was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The worrisomeness of the situation weighed heavily on her mind.

meanings.definition: The act of worrying or being worried.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the worrisomeness after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent2: His worrisomeness was evident in the way he kept checking his phone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's worrisomeness about the new puppy was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The worrisomeness in her voice revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The worrisomeness in the air was almost suffocating.

meanings.definition: The feeling of unease or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The sudden worrisomeness in her gut made her stop in her tracks.
meanings.sent2: The worrisomeness in the room was so thick you could almost touch it.
meanings.sent3: His worrisomeness about the upcoming test was comically exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: The worrisomeness in her eyes betrayed her calm facade.
meanings.sent5: The worrisomeness of the unknown future kept her up at night.
